ALLEGATION:
Facility has not submitted records to MDHHS for permanent retention one year
following the final order of adoption as required.
INVESTIGATION:
On 5/23/2022 I was assigned to investigate an allegation submitted through the on-
line reporting system that the agency did not distribute closed adoption files to the
local offices timely. The allegation named 7 specific files: Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
Youth D, Youth E, Youth F, and Youth G.
Interviews
On 5/26/2022 I conducted an on-site visit and interviewed the agency’s Director.
Director reported that the Administrative Assistant responsible for tracking the closed
adoption file dissemination to local offices was out of the office but would be
available for interview upon return. He stated that there have been times when that
staff has attempted to bring closed adoption files to local offices as well as directly to
MDHHS Document Control in Lansing, but the files would not be accepted due to
there being insufficient storage space in those offices.
On 6/1/2022 I interviewed Administrative Assistant via telephone. She reported that
she didn’t know there was a timeframe of delivering files to local offices within 1
2

month of the year anniversary of finalization. She also stated that the files of Youth
A, B, and C were filed by another support staff in a file cabinet separate from the
other cases finalized in 2020, unbeknownst to Administrative Assistant, which led to
the delay in those files being distributed to the applicable local office. Administrative
Assistant stated that she has already begun the process of tracking finalization dates
to ensure that the cases are distributed to the applicable local office within the 13-
month timeframe rather than the previous practice of distributing the files based
solely on the year the case was finalized. Administrative Assistant added that this
will also change how the files will be transferred to the local offices as the current
practice is to physically deliver them, but they will have to look at mailing files more
frequently than they have in the past to ensure they can meet the 13-month
deadline.

information regarding the cases named in the allegation:

APPLICABLE RULE
ADM 1030 Disposition of Records for MDHHS Supervised Children
For both MDHHS and contracted adoption agency cases, the
local MDHHS office or contracted agency must retain all
adoption case records for one year after finalization of the
adoption. One year (between 12-13 months) past the adoption
finalization date, a contracted adoption agency must send the
original record to the local MDHHS office; copies must not be
maintained by the contracted adoption agency; see licensing
rule R400.12713-Adoption Placement Record.
ANALYSIS: The agency is found in non-compliance as the files named in the
complaint as well as additional files reviewed were not
distributed to the local offices within the timeframe.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
